Mathematical Coffees

List for 2017

You can find bellow the list of Mathematical Coffees for 2017. The chairman of these seminar is Gabriel Peyr√© (CNRS and ENS).

  1. Optimal Transport Meets Machine Learning, (Jan. 20, 14h-17h):
    • Marco Cuturi, ENSAE.
    • Nicolas Courty, IRISA.
  2. Geodesics and Fast Marching (Feb. 3rd, 14h-17h):
    • Laurent Cohen, CNRS and Paris-Dauphine.
    • Jean-Marie Mirebeau, CNRS and Paris-Sud.
  3. Mesh Processing and Vizualization (Feb. 28th, 14h-17h)

  4. Convex Optimization (April 18th, 14h-17h)
    • Alexandre Gramfort, Telecom ParisTech.

  5. Deep learning (May 19th, 14h-17h)
    • Alexandre Allauzen, Paris-Sud

  6. Sparsity and Compressed Sensing (June 8th, 14h-17h)
    • Jalal Fadili, ENSICaen.

  7. Neuro-Imaging meets Machine Learning (July 3rd, 14h-17h)
    • Gael Varoquaux, INRIA.

  8. Patch-based Imaging (Sep. 11th, 14h-17h)
    • Julie Delon, Paris 5.
    • Jalal Fadili, ENSICaen.
  9. Bayesian Inference (Nov. 6th, 14h-17h)
    • Robin Ryder, Paris-Dauphine.

  10. Parallel Stochastic Computing (Dec. 19th, 14h-17h)
    • Emilie Chouzenoux, Paris-Est.
    • Fabian Pedregosa, INRIA.
